text: In this video, we will show you
how to create folders on your iPhone.

First, press and hold
the icon of the first app
you would like to add to the folder.

The option to edit home
screen will appear.
Choose that.

All of your app icons
should start to shake,
with a small minus sign
in the upper left-hand corner of each.
Now press and hold the app icon again
and drag it over to another app
you would like to put in the same folder.

Hovering one icon over another
will create a new folder
with both apps inside.

The folder will automatically
be named by your iPhone

based on the type of
apps you put together.
You can change the name of the folder

in a similar way to how
you created a folder.

While inside the folder,
press and hold an app icon
until "Edit Home Screen" appears.
Choose that again.
The apps will begin to shake,
with a small minus sign in the corner.

You can now change the
title of your folder
to whatever you like.
